Package tournament

Class Match

java.lang.Object
tournament.Game
tournament.Match
public class Match extends Game
Defines a match of table tennis, which is the best of 7 games.
See Also:
  • Game

    Field
    Description
    private final HashMap<Player,Integer>
    gamesDict
    Using a hashmap rather than storing wins in the Player object enforces single responsibility and LoD by not relying on calling a Match.getWinner().getGameWins() in classes that create Match objects for example.
    private int

    Used to differentiate Match objects between tournament rounds.

    Player 1 of 2 players - there may not always be a matchPlayer2 in cases of bye matches.
    private boolean

    Status of whether Match is in progress or finished/not started.

    Player who won the match.

  • Field Details

    • gamesDict

      private final HashMap<Player,Integer> gamesDict
      Using a hashmap rather than storing wins in the Player object enforces single responsibility and LoD by not relying on calling a Match.getWinner().getGameWins() in classes that create Match objects for example.

    • matchPlayer1

      private Player matchPlayer1
      Player 1 of 2 players - there may not always be a matchPlayer1 on object initialisation.

    • matchPlayer2

      private Player matchPlayer2
      Player 1 of 2 players - there may not always be a matchPlayer2 in cases of bye matches.

    • matchNumber

      private int matchNumber
      Used to differentiate Match objects between tournament rounds.

    • onGoing

      private boolean onGoing
      Status of whether Match is in progress or finished/not started.

    • winner

      private Player winner
      Player who won the match.

  • Constructor Details

    • Match

      public Match(Player matchPlayer1, Player matchPlayer2)
      Initialises a Match with two players.
      Parameters:
      matchPlayer1 - Player 1 of 2 players in the match
      matchPlayer2 - Player 2 of 2 players in the match

    • Match

      public Match(Player matchPlayer)
      Initialises a Match with a single player.

      Used for bye matches.

      Parameters:
      matchPlayer - Binds to matchPlayer1, matchPlayer2 is null.

    • Match

      public Match()
      Initialises a Match with no players.

      Used when you don't know what Player objects will be playing in the match.

  • Method Details

    • updatePlayer

      private void updatePlayer(Player player, boolean wonMatch, int expectedGameWins, int gameWins)
      Used to update a Player object without breaking LoD.

      Calls Player.addWin() if wonMatch is true and adjusts Elo.

      Parameters:
      player - Player object that needs updating.
      wonMatch - Boolean whether that player won the match.
      expectedGameWins - How many games they were expected to win.
      gameWins - How many games they actually won.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player matchPlayer)
      Adds a Player to the match.

      If no players are in the match then the matchPlayer is bound to matchPlayer1.

      If matchPlayer1 is set, matchPlayer is bound to matchPlayer2 instead.

      Parameters:
      matchPlayer - Player to be added.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown when addPlayer() is called when there are already 2 players in the match.

    • playMatch

      public Player playMatch()
      Simulates playing a Match.
      Returns:
      Player object of the player who lost the match.

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      Gets an array of the players in the match.

      The length of the array will be how many players are in the match.

      Returns:
      Array of Player objects

    • getMatchNumber

      public int getMatchNumber()
      Getter for matchNumber.
      Returns:
      matchNumber

    • setMatchNumber

      public void setMatchNumber(int number)
      Setter for matchNumber.
      Parameters:
      number - Integer to set matchNumber to.

    • isOnGoing

      public boolean isOnGoing()
      Getter for onGoing.
      Returns:
      onGoing

    • setOnGoing

      public void setOnGoing(boolean onGoing)
      Setter for onGoing.
      Parameters:
      onGoing - Boolean to set onGoing to.

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Getter for winner.
      Returns:
      winner

    • setWinner

      public void setWinner(Player winner)
      Setter for winner.
      Parameters:
      winner - Player object to set winner to.
